identificationModule.briefTitle: A Study to Evaluate the Long-Term Safety and Efficacy of Povorcitinib in Participants With Moderate to Severe Hidradenitis Suppurativa
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Phase 3, Double-Blind Study to Evaluate the Long-Term Safety and Efficacy of Povorcitinib in Participants With Moderate to Severe Hidradenitis Suppurativa

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate long-term safety and efficacy of povorcitinib in participants with moderate to severe hidradenitis suppurativa who completed the 54 weeks of study treatment within the originating parent Phase 3 studies (INCB 54707-301 \[NCT05620823\] or INCB 54707-302 \[NCT05620836\]).

armGroups.label: Cohort A
armGroups.description: Povorcitinib at the protocol-defined dose strength based on cohort assignment.

armGroups.label: Cohort B
armGroups.description: Povorcitinib at the protocol-defined dose strength based on cohort assignment.

armGroups.label: Cohort C
armGroups.description: Povorcitinib at the protocol-defined dose strength based on cohort assignment.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of participants with Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
primaryOutcomes.description: TEAE is defined as any untoward medical occurrence associated with the use of a drug in humans, whether or not it is considered drug-related. An AE can therefore be any unfavorable or unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, or disease (new or exacerbated) temporally associated with the use of study drug.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of participants with Serious Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Serious TEAE is defined as any untoward medical occurrence that, at any dose, meet at least one of the following criteria: (a) results in death; (b) is life-threatening; (c) requires inpatient hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization; (d) results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity; (e) is a congenital anomaly/birth defect; (f) is an important medical event.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of participants with TEAEs leading to study drug discontinuation
secondaryOutcomes.description: Defined as any TEAE that leads to discontinuation of study drug.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of participants who achieve Hidradenitis Suppurativa Clinical Response (HiSCR)
secondaryOutcomes.description: HiSCR is defined as at least a 50% reduction from baseline of parent study in the total abscess and inflammatory nodule (AN) count, with no increase from baseline of parent study in abscess or draining tunnel count.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of participants who achieve Hidradenitis Suppurativa Clinical Response 75 (HiSCR75)
secondaryOutcomes.description: HiSCR75 is defined as at least a 75% reduction from baseline of parent study in the total AN count, with no increase from baseline of parent study in abscess or draining tunnel count.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of participants who achieve Hidradenitis Suppurativa Clinical Response 90 (HiSCR90)
secondaryOutcomes.description: HiSCR90 is defined as at least a 90% reduction from baseline of parent study in the total AN count, with no increase from baseline of parent study in abscess or draining tunnel count.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of participants who achieve Hidradenitis Suppurativa Clinical Response 100 (HiSCR100)
secondaryOutcomes.description: HiSCR100 is defined as a 100% reduction from baseline of parent study in the total AN count, with no increase from baseline of parent study in abscess or draining tunnel count.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of participants with flare at each visit
secondaryOutcomes.description: Flare is defined as at least a 25% increase in the total AN count with a minimum increase of 2 ANs relative to Week 54.
Time to first flare during the long-term extension study.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean change from baseline of parent study in Hidradenitis Suppurativa Quality of Life (HiSQoL) score at each visit
secondaryOutcomes.description: The HiSQoL is a HS-specific, health-related quality of life (QoL) instrument. The HiSQoL total score ranges from 0 to 68, with higher scores indicating higher disease impact on QoL.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Mean change from baseline of parent study in Dermatology Life Quality Index (DLQI) score at each visit
secondaryOutcomes.description: The DLQI is a skin disease specific questionnaire aimed at the evaluation of how symptoms and treatment affect participants' health-related quality of life (QoL). The DLQI total score ranges from 0 to 30, with higher scores indicating lower skin health related QoL.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of participants with no increase in abscess and inflammatory nodule (AN) count relative to Week 54 at each visit
Proportion of participants with no increase in abscess, inflammatory nodule, and draining tunnel (ANdT) count relative to Week 54 at each visit
secondaryOutcomes.description: ANdT count is defined as the total sum of abscesses, inflammatory nodules, and draining tunnels.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of participants with no increase in draining tunnel count relative to Week 54 at each visit
Proportion of participants with a total AN count of 0, 1, or 2 at each visit
secondaryOutcomes.description: AN count defined as the total sum of abscesses and inflammatory nodules.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of participants with a total ANdT count of 0, 1, or 2 at each visit
secondaryOutcomes.description: ANdT count is defined as the total sum of abscesses, inflammatory nodules, and draining tunnels.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Completion of the study treatment period of the originating parent study (INCB 54707-301 or INCB 54707-302).
* Agreement to use contraception.
* Willing and able to comply with the study protocol and procedures.
* Further inclusion criteria apply.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Participation in the extension study could expose the participant to an undue safety risk.
* Women who are pregnant (or who are considering pregnancy) or breastfeeding.
* Further exclusion criteria apply.

ipdSharingStatementModule.description:
Incyte shares data with qualified external researchers after a research proposal is submitted. These requests are reviewed and approved by a review panel on the basis of scientific merit. All data provided is anonymized to respect the privacy of patients who have participated in the trial in line with applicable laws and regulations.

The trial data availability is according to the criteria and process described on https://www.incyte.com/our-company/compliance-and-transparency
ipdSharingStatementModule.timeFrame: Data will be shared after the primary publication or 2 years after the study has ended for market authorized products and indications.
ipdSharingStatementModule.accessCriteria: Data from eligible studies will be shared with qualified researchers according to the criteria and process described in the Data Sharing section of the www.incyteclinicaltrials.com website. For approved requests, the researchers will be granted access to anonymized data under the terms of a data sharing agreement.
